title: The world agrees there's a plastic waste crisis—can it agree on a solution?
body: A bottled water plant in Hollis, Maine, has reduced the plastic in its half-liter bottles by 62 percent since 1994. But the industry could do even more to reduce plastic pollution, some countries say.
readable_content: -ReaderWithAHeart (2023-12-08): Thanks for the article! It's surprising to see the level of resistance against a more aggressive approach to tackle plastic pollution on the international stage. What are your thoughts on the matter?
summary:
The commenter expresses surprise at the resistance to a more aggressive approach to tackling plastic pollution. They seem to be in favor of taking stronger action against plastic pollution. 
Sentiment: 0.8
